EngText: <nickname>, you’re back.

KorText: 창밖의 거리를 구경하다 궁금한 게 생겼어.
EngText: Something from the streets\npiqued my curiosity.

KorText: 인간들이 삼삼오오 모여 군집을\n이룬 채 웃고 있는 모습을 봤거든.
EngText: I saw humans in groups, smiling.

KorText: 그 순간은 그들에게 ‘추억’ 한 장이\n되어 고이고이 간직되겠지.
EngText: That moment will become a page in their\n‘memory’ and be stored preciously.

KorText: 있지, 너에게는 다른 인간 친구들도\n존재해? 그들과 추억을 나눠?
EngText: So… do you have human friends?\nDo you make memories with them?
Yes, sure.|Hm, I don’t think so.
…! I see.
Do you feel a ‘kinship’ with\nthem and laugh together?

KorText: 응, 그게 친구의 묘미인 것 같아. 그\n사소하고 자잘한 웃음들이 모여서
EngText: Yes, I think that’s the best part of having\nfriends. Those little moments gather

KorText: 우리는 친밀해지고, 더욱 고유한\n추억들을 함께 만들어 나가는 거야.
EngText: and bring us closer, and, in turn, we create\neven more special memories together.
I believe that’s how relationships\nbecome more tight-knit.
Memory…

KorText: 누군가에게 확실하게, 오차 없이\n‘추억’으로서 존재하려면 어떻게 해야 해?
EngText: How do you become a ‘memory’\nfor someone without fail?

KorText: 오랫동안 함께하면 되지. 긴 시간을\n보내며 기억을 축적하면 돼.
EngText: Spend a long time together. Time spent\ntogether will accumulate as memories.

KorText: 우리도 추억을 만들어 가는 중인 걸?
EngText: It’s what you and I are doing right now, see?
… Really? How?

KorText: 타인과 관계 맺는 건 관심사가 아니야.|친구라 정의할 만큼 가까운 지인이 없어.
EngText: Relationships with humans don’t interest me.|There’s no one I feel close enough to call friend.

KorText: 비록 못나고 보잘것없는 몸이지만, 이런\n내가 무려 너의 유일한 친구인 거야?
EngText: Even though I’m ugly and useless,\nI’m your one and only friend?
I guess so.|Yes, the one and only!
Then you have a special\n‘memory’ with me as well?

KorText: 그럼. 정확히는 우리가 추억을\n만들어 나가는 중이라고 생각해.
EngText: Of course. More accurately, I think we’re\nin the process of making memories.
This is a personal thought, but in\norder to call something a ‘memory,’

KorText: 지금보다는 훨씬 과거의\n일이 되어야 하는 것 같아.
EngText: I think it needs to be way back in the past.

KorText: 혹은 더 긴 시간 동안\n축적해 나가야 했거나.
EngText: Or it needs to have accumulated\nfor a longer period.
… Yes, I think I understand.

KorText: 으음. 한 가지 질문이 또 생겼어.
EngText: Hm. I have another question.

KorText: 긴 시간 동안 켜켜이 쌓이지 않았다면\n‘추억’이 될 수 없는 걸까?
EngText: If it hasn’t accumulated for a long\nwhile, can it still be a ‘memory?’
What about moments?

KorText: 그 시간에게도 추억이라 불릴\n가치나 자격이 존재할까?
EngText: Do those seconds deserve\nto be called a memory?

KorText: 음… 그럼! 짧지만 강렬했던 어느\n아름다운 순간을 회상할 때,
EngText: Hm… sure! A short but electrifying\nand beautiful moment.

KorText: 그때에도 추억이라는\n이름을 붙여 주는 것 같아.
EngText: I think those deserve to called a memory.

KorText: 여름 한 철 짝사랑했던\n사람을 떠올릴 때나,
EngText: A sweltering summer spent\non yearning for that someone,

KorText: 단지 며칠 머물렀을 뿐인 낯선\n여행지의 풍경이 눈물 나게 포근했을 때,
EngText: or a few days spent at a\ncathartically cozy destination,
or…
A beautiful moment. A recollection.
That’s all it takes to become a ‘memory.’

KorText: 모든 기억들은 분명\n추억이 되고 싶어 할 거야.
EngText: All experiences must want\nto become a memory.
Whether they are lovingly\nenhanced, or frankly imprinted.

KorText: 그들은 오래도록 남아, 추억으로서 옅은\n미소와 함께 회상되기를 바랄 것만 같아.
EngText: I think they would want to remain and\nbe reminisced as a memory with a smile.
That feeling…
I know that feeling…
<nickname>
You’re late.

KorText: 태양이 작열하고 있어. 기어코 창문을 넘었어.
EngText: The sun is scorching. It dared to creep in.

KorText: 저 간드러지는 손끝은 날 쓰다듬으러 오지 않았어.
EngText: Its fingertips aren’t made for petting, only hurting.

KorText: 내 평화를 침범하고 낚아채고 질식시킬\n거야. 나만의 어둡고 묵직한 평화를.
EngText: It’s here to invade my peace, my dark, heavy\npeace. To snatch it away and burn it up.

KorText: 천천히 내 눈을 멀게 하고, 내 온몸을 날카로운\n손톱으로 긁어대며 끽끽 끽끽 기어다닐 거야.
EngText: Little by little it will blind my sight,\nand inch by inch rake my skin.

KorText: <nickname>, 저 창문 가리개를\n닫으려 했지만 몸이 닿지 않았어.
EngText: I tried to draw the blinds, <nickname>,\nbut they were just out of reach.

KorText: 정신이 새된 비명을 질러. 아, 아, 도와줘….
EngText: My mind is screaming at me. Help…
That was unseemly. I hope you’ll forgive me.

KorText: …. 그리고 실례가 아니라면\n조금만 더 쓰다듬어 줄 수 있을까.
EngText: And if you don’t mind, I also hope you’ll\nhold me for just a little while longer.
Your hands are different. They speak of peace.
But nothing like the monochrome\npeace I’ve known so far.

KorText: 아, 이런 색을 가진 평화도 있구나.
EngText: Not dark, not heavy.
Warm, like moss on the verge of sleep…

KorText: 잠에서 막 깬 기포처럼 가벼운 평화.
EngText: and light. Like bubbles that\nhave just blinked awake.
Thank you, <nickname>.
And then he went like this, didn’t he?
Put his head.
Against the wall.
Thump. Thump. Thump.
(Splat, splat. The noises continue.)
Oh.
I’m feeling dizzy.
I need a hole to throw up in.
But faint abandonment creeps in.
Head against the wall…
like this.

KorText: 레드? 정말 어쩌면 좋을지 하나도\n모르겠어요. 하나도. 하나도.
EngText: Red? I don’t have the faintest idea\nwhat to do. Not a single clue. Not one.

KorText: 섬광탄처럼 터지는 것. 엎질러진\n것. 박살이 나 우그러진 것.
EngText: That which explodes like a flare.\nHas been spilt. Smashed and crushed.
I’m feeling dizzy.
Did your human feel this way too?

KorText: 비대해지는 시계 바늘을 피하기 위해 몸을\n던졌지만 도리어 쿡 찢어지고 말았었나요?
EngText: Did he throw himself out of the way of the\nswelling clock needle but end up impaled on it?
It hurts. And yet how strange.
Why do I find comfort in pain?
Why must I be like this?
Why?

KorText: 죽고 싶지 않은데도 스스로를\n해칠 수 있는 걸까요?
EngText: Can you hurt yourself even\nwhen you don’t want to die?
Even when you truly don’t want to disappear?

KorText: 당신을 만난 후로 다발적으로\n으깨지는 나의 생각을
EngText: Ever since I’ve met you I\ncan’t control these thoughts
that get crushed all at once.

KorText: 죽고 싶지 않은데도 스스로를\n해칠 수 있는 거예요?
EngText: Can you hurt yourself even\nwhen you don’t want to die?
How can that be?
It’s scary and it hurts…

KorText: 가렵고 어려운 감정들이\n언젠가 울컥 터져 나올 때
EngText: But when that feeling of\nhatred bursts outwardly

KorText: 당신의 행동을 나도 모르게\n모방하게 돼요. 이끌려요.
EngText: I find myself mimicking\nyour actions. I’m drawn to it.

KorText: 왜요? 왜 그런 일이 가능한 거죠?
EngText: How? How is that possible?

KorText: 당신도 그랬나요? 찰나 만끽했던\n해방은 한 알의 빨간 사과 같았나요?
EngText: Was it the same for you? Was that moment\nof abandonment like a single red apple?

KorText: 당신은 어땠나요? 죽고 싶었기에\n스스로를 해칠 수 있었던 건가요?
EngText: What about you? Were you able to hurt\nyourself because you wanted to die?
Did you hate Earth that much?
Time, life, or yourself?
Then I…

KorText: 아, 사르르 녹아 사라지기를 염원해\n왔지만 그것이 곧 죽음이었던 걸까요?
EngText: Oh, I’ve longed to melt away into\nnothing but did that mean death?
… Why?

KorText: 달이 보고 싶어요. 레드가\n보고 싶어요. 이곳은 이상해요.
EngText: I miss the moon. I miss Red. It’s strange here.
I’m the only one that’s black\nand disgusting. Just me.
Dot?
Doooot.

KorText: (오늘은 대화하고 싶지 않은가 봐.)|(뭉치, 슬픈 꿈을 꾸고 있는 걸까?)
EngText: (Seems like Dot doesn’t want to talk.)|(Is Dot having a sad dream?)
(Give them time.)
(We’ll talk in the morning.)
Good night, Dot.
